Description: We connect scattered information to help anyone find the knowledge they need within 3 seconds.
Higher search weights are assigned to keywords found in the 'Title' compared to the body text.
Supports both standard keyword matching and meaning-based 'Semantic' search.
Indexes text within registered PDFs, Google Docs, and Notion pages, including text in images.
Displays the top 3–5 most relevant document snippets to ensure response precision.
Users can restrict searches to specific periods (e.g., 'Only documents after 2024').
Search results prioritize the latest active version of a document over previous iterations.
Allows users to narrow down results to specific departments such as HR, Finance, or Dev.
The system lowers the weight of meaningless particles/conjunctions to improve accuracy.
Provides optimized filters for finding specific document types, such as report templates.
Search English documents and get Korean summaries (or vice versa).
Supports excluding documents that contain specific 'negative' keywords from results.
Text within document comments or marginalia is also searchable.
Matches documents based on query types, such as 'How-to' vs. 'Numerical Inquiry'.
Document edits are reflected in the search index within a maximum of 1 hour.
Identifies and searches source code blocks within technical docs by programming language.
Indexing is supported for individual files up to 50MB in size.
Architecture is designed to handle real-time searches across over 1 million documents.
Deleted documents are immediately removed from the search index.
The system periodically checks the validity of external links embedded in documents.
Supports filtering by title, author, tags, and the date of the last modification.
Files uploaded to the dedicated Google Drive folder are automatically indexed.
Scanned image PDFs are converted into searchable text via OCR technology.
Only documents approved by administrators are utilized as knowledge for the AI bot.
Legacy documents older than 5 years are archived and excluded from standard results.
Users can search for documents authored by specific individuals or teams.
Search results only display documents permitted by the user’s Access Control List (ACL).
In cases of duplicate content, the most recently edited version takes priority.
Maintains a standardized tagging system (e.g., #Manual, #Regulation, #TechSupport).
The search bot can be invoked directly within Slack or Microsoft Teams.
Uses Reranking logic to optimize results based on user click-through feedback.
Utilizes a high-performance Vector Database to return results in under 1 second.
Sensitive PII (Personally Identifiable Information) in search results can be masked.
Constraints are applied to prevent system overloads from automated mass queries.
Allows users to view knowledge base snapshots to verify historical regulations.
Identifies proper nouns like product or project names for precise matching.
Analyzes captions and metadata for diagrams or charts found in documents.
Uses state-of-the-art embedding models to calculate semantic similarity between sentences.
Detects the user's intent (e.g., requesting explanation, method, or specific figure).
Documents are split into semantic chunks to maximize retrieval accuracy.
Search results for frequently asked questions are cached for near-instant responses.
Remembers the context of previous questions to allow for follow-up search queries.
Expands short user keywords into richer sentences for better semantic retrieval.
Segments text into optimal token units to maximize embedding efficiency.
Combines the strengths of Vector (Semantic) search and Keyword (Lexical) search.
Minimizes wordiness and utilizes bullet points for clear, scannable answers.
Recommends 'Related Search Terms' at the bottom of the response.
If the source is too long, a summary is shown first with a 'Read More' option.
Provides numbered steps (1, 2, 3) when explaining processes or guides.
Lists document names and page numbers for all data points to ensure credibility.
If no relevant info is found, the bot states it directly instead of guessing.
Internally calculates a score representing how well the answer aligns with the source.
Summaries are grounded strictly in the source text to prevent hallucinations.
Includes direct Slack message links for the document's original author.
Uses the blockquote (>) format to highlight key verbatim phrases from the source.
Provides a thumbnail preview of the specific page from which the info was extracted.
Reconstructs tabular data into Markdown format for optimal readability.
Provides direct links to the exact location within Google Drive or Notion.
Knowledge data for different clients is logically separated and isolated.
Indexed text data is encrypted and stored in a secure cloud environment.
Documents requested for deletion are fully wiped within 24 hours, including backups.
Maintains security logs of who searched for which documents.
Sends alerts to the security team if abnormal mass document access is detected.
Analyzes popular search terms to identify and fill knowledge gaps.
Urgent or latest documents can be pinned to the top of search results.
Collects user satisfaction data to fine-tune AI model performance.
Visualizes daily query counts and success rates on an admin dashboard.
Sends notifications when new documents related to a user's interests are added.
Displays an 'Updating' status during mass document uploads.
Automatically corrects typos in search queries to ensure relevant results.
Maintains a mapping dictionary for technical jargon and internal abbreviations.
Holds quarterly training sessions to maximize user proficiency with the bot.
Performs weekly integrity checks of the search index every Sunday morning.
Users can rate search quality using 'Thumb up/down' buttons.
Documents restricted from public view are managed with an 'Internal Use Only' tag.
Copyright for searched documents remains with the original author/department.
Provides guides on using advanced operators (AND, OR, "") for precise searching.
Ensures translation consistency for technical terms during multilingual searches.
Directs users to the relevant department contact if information is missing.
Supports searching locally cached documents even without an internet connection.
